title: P&G Must Innovate
text:
Trader Extra P&G Must Innovate Shares of the consumer-products giant have fallen 13% this year, but habitual underperformance means this isnâ€™t an opportunity for bargain hunters. By Vito J. Racanelli July 18, 2015 
Since briefly approaching a high of $94 in late December, shares of consumer-products giant Procter & Gamble (PG) have fallen 13%, to $82. Normally, that big a drop in a high-quality name would get us bargain hunting. 
Not this time. 
Look back further and the stock has orbited the $80 level for most of the past 24 months, while the market has rocketed higher. The drop this year was caused by the powerful run-up in the U.S.... Get The Full Story
